elements.name: Hydrogen
elements.fact: The only element that can exist without neutrons is hydrogen.which has just one proton, does not require any neutrons to be stable

elements.name: Helium
elements.fact:
Greek word helios, which means sun, is where the name helium derives from.
Atoms of helium can escape earth's gravity because they are so light

elements.name: Lithium
elements.fact:
-Despite being made of metal, it can be sliced with a knife.
-It can also float on water since it is so light.
-Lithium flames are hard to extinguish.

elements.name: Beryllium
elements.fact: -Beryllium is used in X-ray tube windows because it is exceptionally transparent to X-rays.

elements.name: Boron
elements.fact:
-All green plants require the nutrient boron, which is essential.

-can be found in eyedrops

elements.name: Carbon
elements.fact: Carbon can be used to find how old an organic product is through carbon-14 dating. Archeologists use this method all the time.

elements.name: Nitrogen
elements.fact: The majority of the elements in the atmosphere of Earth are nitrogen, which makes up around 78% of the atmosphere.

elements.name: Oxygen
elements.fact: “Breath of life” element as humans need it to inhale. Makes up roughly 21% of earth's atmosphere.

elements.name: Fluorine
elements.fact: The most reactive and electronegative element. This results in it being very easily explosive.

elements.name: Neon
elements.fact: In trace amounts, neon gas is present in Earth's atmosphere and is trapped within the crustal rocks. (Ne)

elements.name: Sodium
elements.fact: It is the sixth most prevalent element on Earth, making about 2.8% of the planet's crust. (Na)

elements.name: Magnesium
elements.fact: Keeps a healthy immune system in our bodies. It can be found in greens, grains and nuts.

elements.name: Aluminum
elements.fact: Very common in the packaging industry for things such as cans and foils. This is because it is lightweight, flexible and durable.

elements.name: Silicon
elements.fact: Similarly to water, silicon is one of the few elements that expand when frozen.

elements.name: Phosphorus
elements.fact: Phosphorus glows in the dark and is used in many flame-related items such as flares and matchboxes.

elements.name: Sulfur
elements.fact: Although many sulfur compounds have a strong smell, the pure element is odorless.

elements.name: Chlorine
elements.fact: Element used in many household products as well as in pools and also sometimes in the form of a poisonous gas

elements.name: Argon
elements.fact: Argon’s found in laser, plasma balls, light bulbs, rocket propellant, and glow tubes

elements.name: Potassium
elements.fact: Potassium is used in soaps, gunpowder, bleaching agents and glass making. Potassium vigorously reacts with water to form hydrogen gas.

elements.name: Calcium
elements.fact: Calcium can be found in many dairies and makes our bones strong.

elements.name: Scandium
elements.fact: Scandium iodide is used in mercury vapor lights to produce light similar to sunlight for photography and film.

elements.name: Titanium
elements.fact: One of the strongest metals despite being much lighter than most. (45% lighter than steel but almost as strong)(highest strength to weight ratio)

elements.name: Vanadium
elements.fact: Most vanadium is used to strengthen steel. Vanadium-steel alloys are used in engine parts, armor plating, axles and tools.

elements.name: Chromium
elements.fact: Chromium is used in stainless steel.

elements.name: Manganese
elements.fact: The ancient Egyptians used manganese compounds to add color to glass.

elements.name: Iron
elements.fact: It is the sixth most common element in the universe. It is also vital to have iron in the human body and lastly the name for iron used to be “Ferrum” which derives from words meaning “holy metal” since it was used to make swords during the crusades.

elements.name: Cobalt
elements.fact: The word “cobalt” derives from the German origin of the word “Kobolds” which means goblin or trouble maker. This element is used to help in the aid of curing cancer “cobalt therapy”.

elements.name: Nickel
elements.fact: Batters are almost all made up partly of nickel.

elements.name: Copper
elements.fact: The statue of liberty is largely made out of copper. It used to be brown like copper pennies but due to oxidizations turned green.

elements.name: Zinc
elements.fact: Zinc can be used as a natural testosterone booster in men. As long as you get enough daily, your testosterone will likely be at a healthy amount.

elements.name: Gallium
elements.fact: Galliums boiling point is eight times higher than its melting point, the largest difference between the boiling/melting ratio of elements.

elements.name: Germanium
elements.fact: Germanium can be used as a catalyst to produce plastics.

elements.name: Arsenic
elements.fact: Arsenic was often found in poison and has been used to poison positions of royalty in the past. It has a nickname of “the king of poison.”

elements.name: Selenium
elements.fact: The greek word “selene” helped create the element name of Selenium as it was named after the moon.

elements.name: Bromine
elements.fact: Can be used as an alternate option to chlorine in things such as pools. Bromine can help sanitize and oxidize pools. Bromine outperforms chlorine in warmer waters and is often found in hot tubs or heated pools.

elements.name: Krypton
elements.fact: Krypton was partially discovered by accident and gets the name from a Greek word “krypto” meaning “hidden.” This is also because the gas is extremely rare.

elements.symbol: SCALES TRANSLATING TO REALISTIC SHOE MEASURMENTS
